comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -692,7 +909,7 @@ static void *sphincsshake256128frobust_gen_init(void *provctx, int selection)
                                                       \
     static void *ecp_##tokalg##_gen_init(void *provctx, int selection) \
     { \
-        return oqsx_gen_init(provctx, selection, tokoqsalg, NULL /* TBD: create hybrid TLS alg name! */, KEY_TYPE_ECP_HYB_KEM, bit_security); \
+        return oqsx_gen_init(provctx, selection, tokoqsalg, NULL, KEY_TYPE_ECP_HYB_KEM, bit_security); \
comment.body: That (tls_)name is only necessary for name->OID mapping. And KEMs don't have OIDs AFAIK.

pull_request.title: Full hybrid support
pull_request.body:
Fixes #3 :
- Updates data structures and logic for hybrid keys to also support signatures
- Implements hybrid signatures
- Adds tests for hybrid signatures

Fixes #6 :
Fixes #7 :
- Adds interoperability tests with oqs-openssl111 for X509 structures (keys, certs) for all supported key types

@bhess: Please note the changes as to how classic key/sig lengths get stored in the `privkey` and `pubkey` structures and how the `comp_*` keys are being used: There are some slight semantics changes aimed at re-using and retaining (most of) the hybrid KEM logic you added while also marshalling data for encoding (and consequent decoding).

@dstebila For now this code maintains & tests full interoperability with oqs-openssl. Once this code gets merged, my [concern raised here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/issues/333#issuecomment-931909690) is dropped and we could begin implementing https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/issues/333 (and/or #39)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -724,7 +941,7 @@ static void *sphincsshake256128frobust_gen_init(void *provctx, int selection)
                                                       \
     static void *ecx_##tokalg##_gen_init(void *provctx, int selection) \
     { \
-        return oqsx_gen_init(provctx, selection, tokoqsalg, NULL /* TBD: create hybrid TLS alg name! */, KEY_TYPE_ECX_HYB_KEM, bit_security); \
+        return oqsx_gen_init(provctx, selection, tokoqsalg, NULL, KEY_TYPE_ECX_HYB_KEM, bit_security); \
comment.body: That (tls_)name is only necessary for name->OID mapping. And KEMs don't have OIDs AFAIK.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -51,6 +57,19 @@ parameter-sets:
     no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: true
     no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
     large-stack-usage: false
+  - upstream: pqclean-aarch64
+    upstream-id: aarch64
+    supported-platforms:
+    - architecture: ARM64_V8
+      operating_systems:
+      - Linux
+      - Darwin
+      required_flags:
+    common-crypto:
+    - SHA3: liboqs
+    no-secret-dependent-branching-claimed: true
+    no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: true
comment.body:
Are actually checking the aarch64 implementation using Valgrind? I thought that's a TODO based on https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1119.  As such this should (for now) be false.

```suggestion
    no-secret-dependent-branching-checked-by-valgrind: false
```

pull_request.title: Adding support for multiple upstream to copy_from_upstream, as well as pqclean's aarch64 kyber implementation
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
There are two parts to this PR:
1) Adding support to copy_from_upstream.py to specify specific upstreams for arch-specific implementations
2) Pulling in pqclean's aarch64 optimized implementation of Kyber.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

+  - upstream: pqclean-aarch64

+      operating_systems:

+      - Darwin
+      required_flags:
+    common-crypto:
